data.prayer: Father, please send new evangelists into the harvest in the county of Bokaro, Jharkhand, India.
data.verse: Ask the Lord of the harvest, therefore, to send out workers into his harvest field.

data.location_label: Photo from the county of Bokaro, Jharkhand, India
data.section_summary: What challenges do people here face?

data.prayer: Lord, let it be said of the 2,039,615 lost in Bokaro that you have called them out of darkness into your glorious light.
data.verse: But you are a chosen race, a royal priesthood, a holy nation, a people for God’s own possession, that you may proclaim the excellence of him who called you out of darkness into his marvelous light

data.prayer: Spirit, protect the overcomers in Bokaro, Jharkhand, India, so that they will one day sit with Jesus on His throne.
data.verse: He who overcomes, I will give to him to sit down with me on my throne, as I also overcame, and sat down with my Father on his throne.

data.prayer: Father, please send teachers of your Word in Bokaro who can speak your gospel boldly and clearly.
Jesus, I pray that all the Lohara people will remember and turn to you, Lord God. May all the Lohara people worship before you. For the kingdom of the Lohara people is yours.
Spirit, please defend the 22,685 believers in Bokaro against an unwillingness to suffer. Give them courage to face social rejection.
Lord, teach the young people in the county of Bokaro to trust your Word and find the path of purity.
data.verse: How can a young person stay on the path of purity? By living according to your word.

data.section_summary:
the county of Bokaro, Jharkhand, India has a population of 2,062,300.

We estimate Bokaro has 22,685 people who might know Jesus, 25,023 people who might know about Jesus culturally, and 2,014,592 people who do not know Jesus.

This is 1 believer for every 90 neighbors who need Jesus.

data.prayer: Father, please give the people in the county of Bokaro access to a Bible in their own language.

location.name: Bokaro
location.people_groups_list: Beldar Laria (Hindu traditions), Rajna, Kawar, Nagarchi (Hindu traditions), Gandhmali
